content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Certainly! Below is the implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)::String
    # Regular expression to match julia code blocks
    code_blocks = r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```"s
    
    # Find all matches and extract code
    matches = match(code_blocks, md)
    code_segments = []
    
    while matches !== nothing
        push!(code_segments, matches.captures[1])
        matches = match(code_blocks, md, matches.offset + length(matches.match))
    end
    
    return join(code_segments, "\n")
end
```

This function will match all Julia code blocks in the markdown string `md`, extract them, remove the code fences, and join the code blocks together with newline characters. The resulting string is then returned.
